title: 108_hr3514
content:
The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including various tracts and ranger residences depicted on specific maps. The Secretary of Agriculture can convey National Forest System lands in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including specific tracts and ranger residences depicted on maps. The maps serve as the primary descriptions of the lands, with the map being the definitive description in case of conflict. Recipients of land may offer other land or cash equalization as consideration for the conveyance. The Secretary may accept a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of land value in exchanges. Land conveyances are subject to National Forest System laws. Preference may be given to public entities for land use. Offers for land conveyance can be solicited with specified terms. Rejections of inadequate offers are allowed. Revocations can occur regardless of other laws. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions for land conveyances to protect US interests. Revocations of public land withdrawal orders are automatic upon land conveyance. SEC. 3. Conveyance of Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. The map will be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. Conveyance of Ridgeway Ranger District headquarters in Elk County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for fair market value. The maps serve as the primary description of the lands, available for public inspection until disposal. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania for fair market value. The maps will be available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey Marienville Ranger Residence in Forest County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936" serves as the primary description of the lands. Upon conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS.

The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales or exchanges under section 2, and consideration from sections 3(b) and 4(b) into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds can be used for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and sites in the Allegheny National Forest, or for acquiring land and interests in land within the forest. The acquisition of lands using these funds is subject to the condition that the market value may not exceed 125 percent of the market value of the lands disposed of under this Act.

SEC. 7. ADMINISTRATION OF LAND ACQUIRED BY UNITED STATES. SEC. 7. ADMINISTRATION OF LAND ACQUIRED BY UNITED STATES.

Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under section 6(b) or by exchange under section 2 shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other laws pertaining to National Forest System lands. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest shall be considered as of January 1, 1965. 

SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES.

Nothing in this Act affects the Secretary of Agriculture's authority to sell, exchange, or acquire land. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act are not subject to certain provisions of title 40, United States Code. Passed the House of Representatives on October 5, 2004. Attest: JEFF TRANDAHL, Clerk.
